meanings.definition: To act or behave in an affected or effeminate manner.
meanings.sent1: He ponced around the room, twirling his scarf dramatically.
meanings.sent2: She ponced with exaggerated gestures, trying to impress her friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat ponced elegantly across the room, tail held high.
meanings.sent4: The peacock ponced proudly, displaying its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent5: The actor ponced on stage, pretending to be a graceful ballerina.

meanings.definition: To obtain something by imposing on or taking advantage of someone.
meanings.sent1: He ponced a free meal from his unsuspecting friend.
meanings.sent2: She ponced her way into getting a discount at the store.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox ponced some extra treats from the farmer.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman ponced a good deal out of the customer.
meanings.sent5: The student ponced extra credit by sweet-talking the teacher.

meanings.definition: To show off or flaunt in an ostentatious manner.
meanings.sent1: She ponced her new designer handbag in front of her friends.
meanings.sent2: He ponced his expensive car, driving slowly past the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The peacock ponced its feathers, trying to attract a mate.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity ponced their luxurious lifestyle on social media.
meanings.sent5: The rich businessman ponced his wealth at the charity event.
